intro: Wikstroemia farreri, commonly known as the Farre's wikstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
